I didn't start transitioning until I was 58.
I guess I was 50.
How'd your family accept you?
Well, my son disowned me.

My family's similar to yours.
Your daughter disowned you?
Both my daughters disowned me, yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah.
When I was growing up, I always knew there was something different.
I didn't like the same things the other boys did.

Right.
But you know, I had to be who I wasn't so that I could survive.
